intro: Galium pusillum var. tendae, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white to pale pink flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal remedies for its mild sedative properties.
